alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Henry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 3:49PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HENRY AND NORTHWESTERN HARRISON COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EST... At 349 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Owenton, moving northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Corinth, Monterey, Slabtown, Fallis, Lockport, Orville, Gest and Bethlehem. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
